examples.text: Ayna, ayna, hadi söyle benden daha arsızı var mı?
examples.translation: Mirror, mirror, come on, tell me, is there anyone more shameless than me?

glosses: the curtain in a shadow play
a wooden or stone slab placed inside a frame in joinery and construction
a thing that reminds someone of something else
the flat end of an oar
a type of telescope used by signalmen on ships
the part of the plough that turns the soil
the flat space on the back of the boats
dryer specifically made to dry tobacco
A clean pond specially prepared for duck hunting
The smooth, shiny surface of tobacco bales.

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish آینه (ayne, ayna), from Old Anatolian Turkish آیِینَه (āyine), from Classical Persian آیِینَه (āyīna).
